items.title: Positivity key to West Ham's upturn in form - Shearer
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer explains how West Ham were able to "play on the front foot" and pressurise Burnley's defence, thanks to the 4-4-2 formation implemented by manager Nuno Espirito Santo in his side's 2-0 win away at Turf Moor in the Premier League.

items.title: England make flying start with convincing win over poor Wales

items.title: How did Arsenal 'unlock' Sunderland's defence?

items.title: 'Unstoppable at his best' - is Palmer in World Cup picture?
items.summary: By scoring a first-half hat-trick against Wolves on Saturday, Cole Palmer provided a timely reminder of his talent, putting himself firmly in the England conversation.

items.title: Ouattara scores late to give Brentford win over Newcastle
items.summary: Dango Ouattara scores in the 85th minute to give Brentford a 3-2 win over Newcastle United, as the visitors win their first game at St James' Park since 1934.

items.title: Everton produce second-half comeback to beat Fulham
items.summary: Everton score twice in the final fifteen minutes to secure a 2-1 away win over Fulham at Craven Cottage in the Premier League.

items.title: Teenager Rayan scores as Bournemouth draw against Villa
items.summary: Bournemouth come from behind to earn a 1-1 draw with Aston Villa, thanks to a goal from Brazilian teenager Rayan on his first start for the club.

items.title: Gyokeres scores twice as Arsenal beat Sunderland
items.summary: Viktor Gyokeres scores two goals as Arsenal comfortably beat Sunderland 3-0 to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points.

items.title: Romero red helps Man Utd continue perfect start under Carrick
items.summary: Goals from Bryan Mbeumo and Bruno Fernandes help Manchester United to a 2-0 win over 10-man Tottenham, who saw captain Cristian Romero sent off for the second time this season in the Premier League.

items.title: West Ham beat Burnley to boost survival hopes
items.summary: Goals from Crysencio Summerville and Taty Castellanos give West Ham a crucial 2-0 win against Burnley, to move them within three points of 17th-placed Nottingham Forest in the Premier League.

items.title: Palmer scores first-half hat-trick as Chelsea beat Wolves
items.summary: Cole Palmer becomes the first player in Premier League history to score three career first-half hat-tricks, as Chelsea see off Wolves 3-1 at Molineux.

items.title: England intensity was superb from the start - Borthwick
items.summary: England head coach Steve Borthwick was delighted with his side's intensity from the beginning of the match and their defensive quality, during the 48-7 win over Wales in their first match of the Six Nations.

items.title: Spotify's About the Song tells you the meaning behind what you're hearing
items.summary: Spotify has been incredibly busy over the past couple of days. After officially launching Page Match, it's introducing About the Song, which it bills as "a new way to explore the stories behind music". This new feature puts short, swipeable story cards in your Now Playing view, which "explore the mâ€¦

items.title: Team GB skeleton helmet appeal dismissed by Cas
items.summary: The British skeleton team - among Team GB's best hopes for medals at the Winter Olympics - will not be able to wear their new helmets after the Court of Arbitration for Sport said they do not comply with the sport's rules around shape.

items.title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
items.summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.
